member.name: T:Utillities.ConsoleApplication.ProgramRunType
member.summary: Defines the program run type of a ConsoleWindow application.

member.name: F:Utillities.ConsoleApplication.ProgramRunType.DebugLibrary
member.summary: The ConsoleWindow application was started via the DebugLibrary. A StreamPipe between them will be created, can cause crashes if not handled properly.

member.name: F:Utillities.ConsoleApplication.ProgramRunType.StandAlone
member.summary: The ConsoleWindow application was started as am application externally, outside the intended DebugLibrary Framework.

The upper limit (default: 1.0f).

member.name: T:Utillities.Wpf.Helper
member.summary: Provides helper methods for developing WPF projects.

member.name: M:Utillities.Wpf.Helper.StringToBrush(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a color string representation into a WPF Brush object. The color string should be in the format: transparency, red, green, blue. Transparency and color values should be represented as two-digit hexadecimal numbers.
member.param: The color string to convert.
member.exception: Thrown when the color string is invalid or has an incorrect format.

member.name: M:Utillities.Wpf.Helper.UpdateButtonHoverColor(System.Windows.Controls.Button,System.Windows.Media.Brush)
member.summary: Updates the hover color of a button.
member.param: The button to update.
The color to apply when the button is hovered.

member.summary: Sets the specified element as active in the window's chrome.
member.param: The element to set as active.

member.summary: Sets the source of an image control to the specified path.

member.name: T:Utillities.Wpf.WindowWrapper
member.summary: Provides a quick way to wrap a window in a border for depper customization.

member.name: M:Utillities.Wpf.WindowWrapper.Wrap(System.Windows.Window,System.Windows.Controls.Panel@,System.Windows.Controls.Border@,System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry@)
member.summary: Will wrap the window in a border which allows for better customization.
member.param: The window to be wrapped
Output parameter that receives the panel containing the window's content.
Output parameter that receives the border wrapping the window.
Output parameter that receives the rectangle geometry used for clipping.
member.remarks: If the old content of the window was not a Panel, a new Canvas is created, and the old content of the window is added to the newly created panel for further usage of the window. The original content of the window is set to null before wrapping it in the border. The rectangle geometry is used to clip the wrapped content to the size of the window.
